page.title: 01GENERAL SURVEY PETT LEVEL
page.content: In this block, nine of the kilometre squares are sea, fished by boats from Rye and Hastings. Only the top left square is completely composed of land, the two adjacent are half sea. The land area sweeps down North to South from the ridge of Pett, farm land, deciduous trees, a few houses to the road from Rye to Hastings,over which are the beach and the sea.The {Royal Military Canal}ends here. Above it stands Toot Rock, once a tiny island.From Fairlight and the west Pett Level is approached by a cliff path.58 acres of cliff land including Stumblet Wood are in the care of the {National Trust,}as are Old Marsham and Marsham Farms.The small corner of Sussex in this block is an interesting peaceful and pleasant one.
